TopicTitle: Re: What do you think about GTX 750

Articles.Content:
I've just bought new graphics card Gigabyte GeForce GTX 750 Ti OC and new LG LED fullHD monitor and game "Watch dogs" 

And this is the coolest it all for my own hard-earned money, and that I myself replaced graphics card, i was afraid that i screw up something, but all was good ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Take look on viedo that i recorded on ShadowPlay ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2D9mHc4RJBo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Cool! I'm currently saving up for the same card. ATM, I've only got a GTX 610. It's such and old type, they don't even have it on their website! I might be able to go today, actually.
There's better cards out there, but the 750 isn't a bad choice

> 
> Cool! I'm currently saving up for the same card. ATM, I've only got a GTX 610. It's such and old type, they don't even have it on their website! I might be able to go today, actually.

My old one was GT 630, note GT 630 not gtx serie, my new video card is a real qualitative leap compared to my old graphics card. The only drawback is that I did not have when I enjoy it because I work most of the week and as I get home I'm very tired. But I'm happy that I have a job.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> There's better cards out there, but the 750 isn't a bad choice

I bought such on which I can afford

I've read that the 700 series offers pretty good performance for the money. I'm a Radeon man myself so I could never consider running on Geforce, but to each their own.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-14T22:32:27Z" title="03/14/2015 10:32  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 14, 2015</time> by segaprophet**

i got one of those. its not bad. i get decent frame rates in all the games i play. sure there is better out there, but dont buy what you dont need. i considered upgrading it next year, but so far its doing well and i dont really think i need better. instead i might upgrade my monitor.

i think the best thing about it is that it is really power effitient, it gets everything it needs from the pcie bus, it doesnt even have a power connector on it. which is great for my mini itx build.

> 
> I've read that the 700 series offers pretty good performance for the money. I'm a Radeon man myself so I could never consider running on Geforce, but to each their own.

I never get that brand adherence. Why not just buy based on the best value/performance for money or the feature set that best fits your needs?
